name: drskradley
text:
If he left in the stuff in brackets, but kept them in brackets without editing it, thus breaking the fourth wall of his writing style - people would definitely buy it. It's the writings of a methodical killer: people eat that shit up.

However, it would be hard to follow with his next release.

name: baryonyx
text:
Jonathan sighed, leaning on the railing. Though the [silence of a limp body lying on the concrete which you truly know will never be able to aggravate you ever again]* was beautiful indeed, it would never compare to how beautiful [the reflection of a man, bound and gagged, in the blade of the broad kitchen knife which he realizes in a moment will take his life]^ was at this moment.

*sunset
^she

name: spinynorman
text:
As the warming rays of the morning sun fell across Frank's face, he sat up in bed, smiled, and turned to look at [handless, jawless gas station clerk with opened chest cavity, his organs marinating in fresh shit]*. He sighed and reached out, hesitated for just one moment, and then stroked [the damp clay down by the binty crick where the bright wet orb laughs and dances on moonless nights and sings its songs of childrens and cold gray dawns.]^

* His girlfriend (will imagine woman's name later
^ Her hair? (further research needed)

I'm glad I searched text for "manflesh" on this page before adding a redundant comment about how Nice Pete is cribbing from the DR_MANFLESH school of search-and-replace.

Wait...

name: peterjoel
text:
[ The small spots of congealing blood emerging as beads along the cracks in the bathroom tiles ]1's not dead.

That's what I told myself in the days after the accident. [ Crippled piglets futilely suckling the teat of a dead sow ]2's in stasis, and perhaps someday, perhaps when we return . . . I used the title [ The Death Sound and I have cut my body ]3.

For a while, I was "acting" in name only. [ The final life-twitch of the impaled body of the carpet cleaner salesman ]4 pretty much ran things. After a month or so I began to recover enough to notice what was going on around me. Most of the [ experiments using desiccated spleen and woven ligaments ]5 were sad, resigned. There was only one [ thing to do with a person who is not yet dead ]6 who looked the way I felt. [ Fresh bile leaks from the new hole I made ]7.

[1] She
[2] She
[3] Acting Captain
[4] Tuvok
[5] crew
[6] person
[7] Seven

I'm curious. What is your avatar? From whence did it hail?

Because, and I've been sitting on this for a while, not wanting to offend, I hate it. The vast difference in hair colors there bothers me to no end. I'm sorry. I had to come clean.

I think tekende was refering to the good professor, but, yes, it is comic genius Chris Elliot from Cabin Boy. And it is awesome that you believe that to be awesome.

Your avatar is... a samurai having a bourbon? Without the name, I would guess it to be some sort of a giant man in a tunic.

name: bourbonsamurai
text: It is actually a giant viking statue that guards a dump in Virginia. Somewhere I have a picture that matches my name, perhaps I will one day swap it out. But for now, the viking pleases me.

name: baryonyx
text: It's always looked sort of like a humanized version of Lyle to me, though I'm sure that's not it.

name: professorhazard
text: Lyle and I share many traits; I have often thought that we are like chocolate-covered pretzels, he and I - complicated and salty on the inside, dark and associated with fecal humor on the outside.

name: professorhazard
text:
It's a drawing of me that I use as my avatar. I guess we won't be hanging out much because, as shown, my hair is bleached blonde and my beard is brown. Never known it to fundamentally offend anybody.

Photos of me with comparative illustrations can be seen here: http://professorhazard.deviantart.com/

You can find fan art people have drawn of me in the Favorites area, and if you look far enough in my gallery, you'll find a nice picture I drew of Ray in the hot tub.

name: heccibiggs
text: Well, someone saw an opportunity to shamelessly plug their devART gallery.

name: myrrdisparo
text: True. I need to play Starcraft again. I'm getting all rusty and whatnot. Now I'm left wondering who Adun was.

name: baryonyx
text:
Adun was the great Protoss hero who formed the discipline of the Khala, ending the Aeon of Strife, a long and bloody Protoss civil war triggered by their abandonment by the Xel'Naga. The Protoss phrase "En taro Adun" translates into "In honor of Adun" and was eventually replaced in the lexicon by "En taro Tassadar" after Tassadar's martyrdom against the Overmind during the fall of Aiur.

Go ahead, laugh.

name: myrrdisparo
text: I distinctly remember some Protoss saying "En taro Adun, cerebrate" to Kerrigan. I may be wrong, because I think it was Tassadar who said that, and Tassadar was dead before the Queen of Blades came to being. I'm confused but amazed. A chubby for you.

name: baryonyx
text:
No, I think that's correct, as Tassadar was not dead by the time Kerrigan was created. They encountered one another on Char where Tassadar was living among the Dark Templar, before the Zerg invasion of Aiur.

I don't deserve the responsibility of a long-term memory center.

text: stewardesses

you're all so wrong.

although I'd love to be mr. Tassadar.

name: lateadopter
text:
Okay, with that clue, I'll hazard:

Wasted


It just occurred to me that you could be placing your hand in a non-standard position on the keyboard, or typing in a non-touch-type way (e.g., hunt and peck), or you could have really big hands. In other words, the clue you provided does not really narrow down the possible combinations of letters that could be in your name.

name: dr_strangeglove
text:
completely standard, my dog. pinky on the "A", pointer on the "F."

hint: think modern Western Literature, folks!

name: dr_strangeglove
text: I'd give better hints, but that would probably make it way too obvious. So here it is: My last name is Saavedra. Miguel de Cervantes Saavedra, author of Don Quixote, arguably the first truly modern western piece of literature.

name: drskradley
text: Oh of course.  I was about to say Saavedra.  Truly I was.

name: drskradley
text: (I was not)

name: audhumla
text: and here i was going to guess taft

name: jlowe424
text: Sad As A Vast East Desert Red Art?  That's an awkward name...can we just call you Saavedra for short?

name: lechatbotte
text:
Oh. I didn't know that Cervantes had a second last name. But I'm pretty sure he actually wrote "Don Quixote de la Mancha" which was published in four volumes. While I wouldn't begin to call it "modern", it certainly was Western, and spawned much of the anti-romanticism that we now call "modern". (Am I the only one bothered by the Musical version "Man from LaMancha" being so anti-realist?)

Anyway, I've a mate a few streets over named Saavedra. I shall now proceed to razz him properly. Yes, I shall.

name: mattfish
text:
Here, I'll format it as an analogy for the SATs

"the moment when a young boy has truly died, his hair moving in the breeze, yet his body perfectly still" : "Mary" :: "watch mentally ill men take long, cold baths without suds" : _____

A. watch mentally ill men take long, cold baths WITH suds
B. watch mentally SOUND men take long, cold baths without suds
C. watch mentally ill men take long, WARM baths without suds
D. have consensual sex

A%u25CA B%u25CA C%u25CA D%u25CA

name: mattfish
text:
My answer sheet bothered assetbar, here's another copy

A O B O C O D O

name: xi
text: chubbied officially, dry humped hard and long unofficially.

name: falseprophet
text: Well hell I mean for sure, unofficial is the entire point of dry humping which was a convenient method among early teens to enjoy the physical act without the danger of creating after-party babies but since the growth in population of The Blowjob as the new official unofficial in the wake of the Monica Lewinsky scandal, dry humping has been so difficult to orchestrate since the 90s.

name: flazisismuss
text: It's almost hard to remember a time before the blowjob at this point.  Yet another positive legacy of the Clinton years - that was all so much fun.

name: miku224
text: So many chubbies, sir.  So many chubbies.

name: justa
text: Love Teodor's response to Nice Pete's initial question. You can almost hear him thinking "Wait, what kind of twisted Nice-Pete related thing am I going to become embroiled in by answering this?"

name: brian
text: Nice Pete writes a lot like David Foster Wallace.

name: flazisismuss
text: Except the sentences are shorter, and the story a tad less self-indulgent, even if it is a story fueled by a serial killer's memory for bloodlust.

name: loneal
text: Chuck held [the moment when a young boy has truly died, his (the boy's) hair moving in the breeze, yet his (the boy's) body perfectly still] in his (Chuck's) arms, considering lobsters all the while. Soon they (Chuck and Mary) would move to Africa together via cruise ship, the name of which would strike Chuck as ironic and which he would rename with the antonym of the original name, an act about which he would be slightly self-deprecating, but ultimately self-congratulatory, but tonight they (Chuck and Mary) would lie in bed and [watch mentally ill men take long cold baths without suds].

name: tommycrashwreck
text: Make sure this is the fourth part of an aside to an aside, and that the original text as well as the original aside to which this aside is an aside have been swallowed up by DFWallace's forgetful structure, so that the current aside has become the new main body of the work.

name: infinitejest
text: I really have to give you a chubby for this, given my user name.

name: hbaranov
text: You should never be bound so.

name: xi
text:
I was laughing out loud at panel four, and even through halfway through the last one... but... but... it turned into an awkward chuckle and finally distraught silence when I read "watch mentally ill men take long, cold bath without suds".

I mean... holy god.

name: spinynorman
text: I've said it before - Nice Pete is basically a lose hose flopping around, spraying the creepiest shit you ever heard all over the place. I mean, this plus comparing women to the sound of "birds burning in a shoebox"... Pete is creepier when he is not directly homicidal, just Disturbed.

name: brycemidas
text: Are you trying to say that Pete gets Down with the Sickness?

name: hbaranov
text: 'gets Down?' He never got 'up' I think.

name: bjorntd
text:
This art is from... HISTORY!

I wonder how many of these little chats Teodor and Nice Pete have, and why they seem to be in the same house so often. Don't they live separately?

name: tekende
text: Yes, that would be why Nice Pete had to call Teodor rather than just go find him in another room.

name: wittyname
text: I like to pretend that 'A Marvelous Romance' is the title of the a marvelous romance novel, but deep down I know it is not.

Well it's a marvelous night for a moondance
With the stars up above in your eyes
A fantabulous night to make romance
'Neath the cover of October skies.

. . . can't get that song out of my head now.

name: autrepoupee
text: peter sotos actually uses this method but backwards

name: colorlessness
text: Too awesome for the Peter Sotos reference.

name: autrepoupee
text:
I've never been prouder of an internet community in my life than when I got 5 chubbies for a Peter Sotos reference.

Acheworld, you have done me right by me !

name: colorlessness
text: You should go over to the Susan Lawly message board then, they chubby that sort of shit all the time.

name: lateadopter
text: I think the disturbing part is Teodor's blase response to Nice Pete's utterly dehumanized description of a woman.  The boys have just gotten so used to Nice Pete that they don't even blink anymore.

name: erinye
text:
Seriously.

How does Nice Pete write women so well?

name: boredom_man
text: It is, ultimately, your avatar in this conversational thread that will be the difference between Nice Pete Chuckles and Nice Pete Nightmares for me.

name: deusoma
text: If I were aware that the person I was talking to had a history full of gruesome murder, it wouldn't matter how fucked up his choice of conversation is, I'm not reacting badly. "Incredible death" is not something I want on my schedule.

name: bourbonsamurai
text: Then you should stop your two-timing! You have been warned!

name: drskradley
text: You should also stop causing epilepsy with your avatar.  Guys like Nice Pete don't take kindly to his loved ones being forced into fits.

name: drskradley
text: That's right - CAUSING epilepsy.  Yes, I just thought about how ridiculous that is.  But gosh darnit, Deusoma is doing it.

name: deusoma
text: Yeah, I should probably go ahead and change it anyway. They had an episode where it actually was lupus a while back.

name: dapooka
text: But if you change it, how can I look forward to the spontanteous Frye & Laurie reunions simulated between you and Spinynorman?

name: spinynorman
text: Man, how have I never noticed that.

name: lechatbotte
text: Befuddles me, Jeeves.

name: baryonyx
text: I for one have an appreciation for the unnecessary comma in "I see. A, 'writer's trick.'" It goes a long way in conveying precisely the way in which Nice Pete speaks.

name: retinarow
text: Yes, I, agree,.

name: spectre
text: and thinks

name: bjorntd
text: The prescriptivist in me absolutely hates the whole "comma as breathing space" syntax that he's supporting here, but I suppose I'm allowed to be a bit of a pedant now and again.

name: hbaranov
text: He should have used ellipses.

name: tekende
text: No. It doesn't have the same effect.

name: lechatbotte
text:
An ellipse just sort of trails off... and on... again. It's dreamy and stoned.

A comma, it, breaks harder. Like the crackle of dry bones in a bag. So much more Nice, Pete.

name: phthoggos
text: Nice Pete's violence against English usage is less well-known, but even more horrific than his violence against individuals.

name: budenhagen
text: Jesus CHRIST!

name: breadcrab
text: It'll be okay, Face of Philippe.

name: parkman47
text: 10000000000000000x better than DPM from the previous strip... welcome back, chris!

name: hardelicious
text:
I really [removed clothing with trauma shears, then placed into bathtub filled with ice before slowly lowering myself in next to]* today's strip.

*"enjoyed"

name: nickgranger
text: It is never fun when Pete calls.

name: baryonyx
text: But you sure as hell answer if you know what's good for you.

name: jordstar
text: That is the creepiest description of a woman I've ever read. It's the kind of creepiness that, were someone to steal it and use it, expanded, in a film, could give a generation nightmares a la Hannibal Lecter.

name: loneal
text: This is made even creepier for me by the fact that my mother's name is Mary and my uncle's name is Chuck. This is like the time someone suggested the game "Fuck, Chuck, or Marry" and I emphatically said, "Neither."

name: achilleselbow
text:
Women are clear, like a horrible toy with no color in the plastic.

Also, there are many ways to read Teodor's hesitant response to the initial question, focusing either on his uncertainty regarding Nice Pete's motives, or his previous interest in Hiram the Blacksmith.

name: joeynarcotic
text: Nice Peter scares the shit out of me. I love him.

name: johnnyc
text: Do not call him Nice Peter, you do not know how poorly he takes to that.

name: qeramah
text:
It's been too long since we've had a Nice Pete strip.

This is refreshing.

name: sn0wman
text: With Nice Pete, it must be specified that the sex will be consensual.

name: rogergs
text:
The trick also works in reverse for the rest of us.

Hunting for the final roll of duct tape that would fit in the toolbox, Wilbert couldn't stop thinking about [Scarlett Johansson][1]. Would he [gently caress the down in the small of her back][2]? Or perhaps just cut to the chase and [have consensual sex in a Guccione bed with black, slick sheets][3]. Blood drained from his head and he felt dizzy just thinking about it.

[1] the hogtied seventh-grader
[2] cut V-shaped slices from his ears and cheeks
[3] sever his head and install it on the computer desk

name: chuvak
text: Wow, make your own Ellis novel. Nice.

name: poing
text: This is the best Achewood strip in over a year.  The way nice Pete delivers his line in panel 4 with such conviction is so precious.

name: loneal
text: P...Poing? You okay there, buddy? Can I get you anything? Glass of ice water? Smelling salts?

name: drskradley
text:
The man has Reasons for What He Does.

Or she does. I'm a product of a sexist culture, I automatically assume someone is a man.

name: dovey
text: I don't think any feminists will hold it against you that you assume that a total dickwad is a man.

name: loneal
text:
It's true! Dr. Skrad, you get double points today. Point 1 for being all patriarchy-examining, and point 2 for not insisting on Poing's stated female gender.

Does that make any sense? I just took some Ambien like twenty minutes ago and it is really kicking in hard. Is this what it feels like when Ray knows about 45 degrees? There's weird splotches of color everywhere. I need to go to sleep.

name: seanbad
text: Just don't be surprised if your significant other insists that you sleep in another room. Ambien does weird things to a person. I'm told I tried to choke my wife?

name: loneal
text: Yes, apparently I have left some embarrassing phone messages while under the influence of Ambien.

name: drskradley
text:
My mother was a feminist.

And, being a comics fan, a blog has opened my eyes to how messed up the gendered world currently is:
HERE

Perhaps not mind-blowing to anybody else, but I never did Women's Studies or anything so this blog explained it well, I thought.

name: loneal
text: It really is eye-opening, isn't it? That stuff is right in front of you, and you don't notice it until someone else points it out, and then you see it motherfucking everywhere.

name: mnemonicdevice
text: That one's going to haunt me.

name: chuvak
text:
Q: What does nice pete see at the strip club?
A:

[IMGS OFF]

name: achilleselbow
text: If you could only somehow have depicted the smells emanating from their horrible large middles.

name: peterjoel
text: Please don't do that. Photoshop was never meant for such as that.

name: tekende
text: Yes, that would be terrible.

name: bjorntd
text: BOO TO THAT.

name: achilleselbow
text: How do you know woman smells are bad?

name: phthoggos
text: THEY MUST BE

name: tekende
text: WHY FIND OUT

name: tommythebrat
text:
I find it funny that Theodor is the only character who is actually troubled that Nice Pete is a serial killer...who kidnapped Phillipe once....and tried to murder him with a USB-connected kitchen knife....

I am just saying that there are better things to base a relationship on than constant terror. Like say a shared interest in Japanese cultur, perhaps?

name: the_prophet
text:
To many of us, constant terror and Japanese culture are inextricably connected, myself included.

They are both however, things I base my relationships on.

name: hellofditties
text:
OH...OH MY GOD! THIS STRIP! THE... THE PERFECT THING TO SAY, EVER!


SPLUT!

name: hellofditties
text: The splut was my head exploding from the Awesome, of course.  Please do not lame me.  I am still coming to terms with the fact that I am a screaming clear area with a wig on.

name: jalhalla42
text: Pete's next book: A Perplexing Mystery

name: dovey
text: Followed hotly by An Astounding Science-Fiction.

name: tekende
text: And then A Magical Fantasy

name: dasilodavi
text: This one gets a five from me.  I didn't find it particularly "funny" per se, but it gives a great deal of insight into Nice Pete, not just in the last panel but in the entire act of him attempting to write the next great American love story, a cold mimicry of things he perceives as acceptable in society.

name: hrm
text: Imagine if the book were published, but Nice Pete forgot to replace some of the things he loved.

name: billylk
text:
[IMGS OFF]
Disapproves

name: comrade_tom
text: How dare you speak for Mr Nicholson.

name: bjorntd
text: THE ONLY PERSON WHO SPEAKS FOR JACK NICHOLSON IS YOUNGER JACK NICHOLSON

name: hbaranov
text: What about Jack Nicholson from Space? Is he younger because of the dreadful genetic splice incident and then the subsequent light speed journey around the sun?

name: jlowe424
text:
I held [a starving stray dog, lured with kind words and fed canned food mixed with broken glass]* and realized I felt the same [the sensation of telling a boy you've killed his parents because he couldn't scream loud enough; he can never scream loud enough]** as I did when I first met [a young prostitute, desperate for money to feed her child but still young enough to know shame, being paid to break her own fingers]***

*Mary
**Love
***Her

name: tekende
text: Cheese and rice!

name: jlowe424
text: I wish I was still in my senior year of high school, taking a creative writing class and getting sent for psychological evaluation after being "inspired" by a comic strip like this.  Patrick Bateman would've come to my book signing, but he had to return some tapes.

name: dapooka
text:
Jlowe424, reading these two comments and seeing the Corinthian as your avatar is isn't helping me think you are a nice guy.

I'm getting a case of the not-so-rad chillies.

name: tekende
text:
Teodor is indeed a man who loves women. Can't keep his mind on nothin' else. He%u2019d trade the world for a good thing he%u2019s found. If she is bad, he can%u2019t see it.
She can do no wrong.

name: tekende
text:
BBCode raped my hilarious Michael Bolton reference. Oh, curses upon you, BBCode!

My reference! My reeeeefffferennnnnceeee!

name: bjorntd
text: Assetbar screwed up, Tekende completely hates BBCode.

name: lateadopter
text: I had sympathy with your BBCode troubles, but then you claimed that was a Michael Bolton song.  Now, I will not join your fan club until you apologize to Percy Sledge.

name: tekende
text: Man I wondered why there were two different artist names comin' up on the Google search.

name: sn0wman
text: A comment left by sn0wman was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by straw, loneal, smugairle)

name: falseprophet
text: My Manwiiiiiiich!

name: wittyname
text: I don't know why I'm compelled top tell you this, but I read your webcomic in one sitting yesterday, tekende. It was... okay. I probably should explain why it was just okay, but this is a weird enough comment anyways so I'm going to cut it short.

name: tekende
text:
Yeah, it is not the Greatest Comic on the Face of the Earth. Just...I didn't write all of it, so I can't be blamed entirely. I just drew the pictures.

But thanks for reading it!

If you would like to explain why it was just okay, you can e-mail me, I guess? springertekende@yahoo.com

name: catgrl131
text:
You have a comic?
Hot Dog! Post a link, please, so that I may gaze upon the contents and judge it as I see fit.

name: tekende
text: Here.

name: nbgreene
text: A comment left by nbgreene was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by straw, kylank, glue, cellphonedick, Justa)

name: bjorntd
text: Ha ha what

name: justa
text: Come on man Nice Pete ain't even been to Vegas since 1978.

name: nbgreene
text: I dont think pete was involved.  Seems more like philippe and lyle got bored of electrocuting pat's dick. am i the only one who thought of them when i heard this story?

name: stevepants
text: hahahaha pete is fucked up

name: al_batross
text: Nice Pete clearly needs to have his own Madlibs brand.

name: neonfreon
text: nice pete is definitely one character i would like to see spin off into his own comic strip.  seeing someone as fucked up as him makes me feel better about myself.

name: lateadopter
text:
CHOOSE YOUR ADVENTURE

A serial killer calls and asks you to come to his house.

A) You go to his house. Go to page 23.

B) You do not go to his house. Stay on this page. He will come to you.

name: xi
text: Gorgeous.

name: bourbonsamurai
text: Possibly my favorite comment ever, lateadopter.

name: contrasoma
text: Out of chubbies - I offer a tip of the hat instead.

name: supergeorgina
text: I love Nice Pete's demeanor throughout.  He is a professional weirdo, through and through.

name: evolume
text: this is the most terrifying thing i have ever read in a comic strip.

name: stopeatingmyeyes
text:
http://achewood.com/index.php?date=01032007

teodor should've known

name: mc_white
text: Does anyone else have nightmares that end with Nice Pete staring at you with his head cocked ever so slightly as in panel four?  Or is that just another sign that I'm way in over my head with this cocaine?

name: bourbonsamurai
text: If you're still able to sleep and therefore have nightmares, you've got some breathing room on the cocaine thing.

name: daidai
text:
This strip is [the feeling I get when I see a gypsy woman caught pickpocketing and is then smacked].

[]-funny

name: tombsgrave
text: Awesome strip.  At least Nice Peat has a healthier attitude about women than Dave Sim.

name: tombsgrave
text: Pete, I mean Pete.  Nice Peat is... oh God, I don't want to think too much about where that peat comes from.

name: cellphonedick
text: Out of 214 comments, not counting my own, there are only 29 lames registered on them.  This seems very low, and it makes me happy that people are not being very lame, not very lame at all.

name: comrade_tom
text: Lie-Bot, whats the lamest thing a person can do?

name: featurelessvoid
text:
A person writes erotic fan fiction in which one of the main characters is Ray Smuckles's mom and another is Chris Onstad. In the final scene, they both climb on a motorcycle and jump over a pool containing a shark that's busy mauling Philippe. They narrative pauses for a three-paragraph observation of how the hapless otter is Five. The person then posts this story to Acheworld. With illustrations.

That, comrade_tom, is the lamest thing.

name: catgrl131
text: Oh holy crap and wow we need this to be a Thing

name: achewood
text: A comment left by achewood was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by nokidding, randombeing, invidious, snoozebar)

name: andyfaewatford
text:
That's it! I've done it! It's been hard in places and my eyes kind of hurt but I have now read all the strips on this site, in order. Today is the day that I caught up with today, if you see what I mean...

I'm not expecting a medal or anything, just thought I would put this comment here for my own amusement. Not like anyone's ever going to read it right down here at the bottom of the page anyway...

Yeah, good on me.

name: straw
text: As a congratulations, I will dole out some chubbies for you on the comments you no doubt have strewn hither and thither throughout the archives, as my allotment for this comic has been met.

name: bourbonsamurai
text: Hooray andy!

name: andyfaewatford
text: Aww, shucks. Thanks guys...

name: dapooka
text: Hooray.  Exactly one month behind ya, but catching up fast.

name: ih8jonmayr
text:
This book will be printed in [the blood of a virgin]*

*ink

name: gmm
text: This one is just straight up amazing. Teodor is unsure about if he is a man who likes women. Nice Pete is fucking insane.

name: ladybug
text: If that isn't a well deserved five, I don't want to know what is.

name: ham_shoes
text: Hallmark meets Titicut Follies.

name: lolgolfer
text: This strip is like Lawrence of Arabia with cats.

name: masterbbb26
text: glad to see Pete again. this comic was missing the touch of a god damn lunatic.
